thread.title: Plymouth boss Derek Adams tells Liverpool: "Welcome to the real world!" after securing FA Cup replay
thread.title_full: Plymouth boss Derek Adams tells Liverpool: "Welcome to the real world!" after securing FA Cup replay

author: David Maddock
title: Plymouth boss Derek Adams tells Liverpool: "Welcome to the real world!" after securing FA Cup replay
text:
Derek Adams' Plymouth earned an FA Cup third-round replay against Liverpool (Photo: Getty Images) Share Get Liverpool FC   
Liverpool were warned they will be “welcomed to the real world” after plucky Plymouth pulled off an FA Cup miracle at Anfield. 
The tiny League Two club produced a disciplined, courageous defensive performance to snatch at 0-0 draw at Anfield, and earn a famous replay at their ramshackle Home Park Stadium next week. 
If that meant the Reds’ young side – Jurgen Klopp fielded the youngest team in the club’s history – were given a shock, then Plymouth boss Derek Adams insisted it is nothing compared to the welcome in store for them at the third round replay. 
“The fans have a long trip home, but they were very vocal for us and deserved the day out – everybody at the club is very happy,” he said. 
“We look forward to taking them back. Look forward to what they will experience there: welcome to the real world! Our dressing rooms are not as luxurious as they have here... and they’ve got portakabins here at the moment.” Plymouth battled to a 0-0 draw on Merseyside (Photo: Michael Steele) 
Adams was overjoyed with his team’s defensive performance, and he believes Plymouth will have a chance of an even bigger shock in the return if they can repeat their staunch rearguard. 
And with the replay also on TV, then he cheekily suggested it may even earn the club a new stand. Asked if his team could win the replay, he replied: “I don’t know about that but we will give it a real go. 
“We defended brilliantly here - one of the best defensive performances Anfield has ever seen. We will have to defend like that again if we are going to have a chance. Plymouth duo Graham Carey and Sonny Bradley embrace at full-time (Photo: Getty Images) 
“Of course we will have to open them up a bit to get through, but it will be a great night for the club, a deserved night, and we are getting closer to building that new stand!” 
While Adams couldn’t keep the smile off his face, Reds boss Jurgen Klopp was less pleased, and he took full responsibility for the failure to progress through to the fourth round when he said: 
“We have to go to Plymouth – that’s it. Yippee. It is my responsibility, the line up, performance. We could have done better. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
